messages.body:
AUDTING AND ACCOUNT UNIT.
BANQUE INTERNATIONAL AFRIQUE
DE L' OUEST,LOME,REPUBLIC
OF TOGO.

Dear ,

I am privileged to write you through the Internet as
the DIRECTOR OF AUDITING at the account section of
BANQUE INTERNATIONAL AFRIQUE DE L'OUEST here in LOME
REPUBLIC DU TOGO (B.I.A).

Our late Customer, a national of Your Country who died
along with his wife and his Two sons in an auto crash
accident along Sagwamah express road LOME over 3 years
now was an astute businessman, an oil merchant and
contractor here in TOGO and he left behind a deposit
of Ten Million,Two Hundred Thousand United States
Dollars only($10,200,000.00usd) in his domiciliary
bank account in above mentioned BANQUE INTERNATIONAL
AFRIQUE .

Efforts made by the Bank to get in touch with of any
of his relatives proves no success and due to the
perceived possibilities of not being able to locate
any of his relatives or business associates( since no
record of any relatives is known to us) made the
management of this bank under the influence of our
Chairman and some members of the Board of Directors,
to have series of meetings and decided to declared the
fund 'unclaimed' and subsequently send it to the
Government Suspense Account for funding of the
purchase of arms and ammunition to further enhance the
course of War in Africa.

In order to avert this negative development, I on
behalf of my trusted colleagues now seek your
permission to have you stand in as next of kin to Our
late Customer so that the fund will be released and
paid into your account as the beneficiaryåÕs next of
kin now that the bank is still expecting a next of kin
or relative of the deceased. Infact we could have done
this deal alone but because of our position in this
country as civil servants, we are not allowed to
operate a foreign account and that would eventually
raise an eye brow on our side during the time of
transfer since we still work in this bank, this is the
actual reason why we required a second party or fellow
who will assist us forward claims as the next of kin
and also provide either an existing bank account or to
set up a new Bank a/c immediately to receive this
fund, even an empty a/c can also serve for this
purpose.

Note that all needed documents to enable the fund get
to your account will be carefully worked out and
meanwhile,all the whole arrangement to put claim over
this fund as the bonafide next of kin to the deceased
and to get the required approval and transfer this
money to a foreign account has been put in place and
all necessary information will be disclose to you as
soon as you indicate your interest and willingness to
assist us.

On smooth conclusion of this transaction,you will be
entitled to 25% as gratification for your assisting
us, while 5%will be set aside to take care of expenses
on our both sides that may arise during the time of
transfer and also for telephone bills, and the
remaining 70% will be for me and my partners.

Meanwhile we will be monitoring the whole situation
here in this bank until the money is confirmed into
your account and we shall come down to your country or
any nominate place for us to meet for subsequent
sharing of the fund accordingly as indicated above and
further investment, either in your country or any
country you advice us to invest in. All other
necessary information will be send to you when we hear
from you.

Bear in mind that this proposal is 100% risk free. I
suggest you get back to me as soon as possible stating
your wish in this business Via


Yours faithfully,

Allround Nteje.

How are you ? hope you are ok , i am very very sorry
for my late response i was way for a duty in another
little city near my home town.
I just come in saw your mail,hope am forgiven ?

understand the the transaction before we go in .

I really appreciate your understanding and I consider
it important to give you the details of this
transaction. This transaction is legitimate and in
essence it will undergo normal procedures as
stipulated in the financial and allied matters act and
all legal documents will be issued in your name.

I contacted you to portray you as the next of kin ,
you can put claims to this huge amount he left behind
as his next of kin. I want to assure you also that I
have every information and documents the finance
company may require to approve your claim

You will be entitiled to 40% of the total fund at the
conclusion of the transaction, 20% goes to charity
because late MR Raymond Beck was involved in some
chari ty organisations and he intended to build a
charity foundation before his death, out of the 
($10,200,000.00usd i intend to open a charity
foundation in his name in order to immortalise his
name, while 40% of the money will be mine because i
will provide all the information that will lead to
release and transfer of  the  money to you. Three days
after the release of the money to your account, i will
come over to your country for disbursement/sharing of
the fund according to the agreed parcentage.

Late MR Raymond Beck was born in 1944.He operated an
account with our bank . Lome-Togo until his death.
You must understand that in the bank , chances or
opportunities like this are common but not heard.
People put their money in finance companies and some
of these accounts are either coded or confidentially
operated, therefore, when such people die what do you
think that happens to these money when nobody comes
for their claims? Well, this is one of the numerous
avenues good "free" money are made within and the
officials.

I will appreciate you send your full address and your
occupation in your next email.

As soon as you indicate your interest to claim this
fund, I will send the text of application form and
further instructions you will send to the finance
company for the claim. Please note that this
transaction requires utmost trust, sincerity and
confidentiality for its successful conclusion.
Upon Reciept of your next mail i will forward and
application which you will fill and send to the bank
for the release and transfer of the fund into your
designed bank account.

You can always reach me on  +2289115612 for further
clarifications.

I await your prompt reply.

Best Regards,
Mr Allround Nteje

messages.body:
Sir

I accept your apology and I am glad we can proceed
with business now.

Sorry to hear you got demoted from your diamond job.
Unfortunate that politics got in the way of your
career, but that's beaurocracy for you. Hopefully you
won't face such discrimination again. Then again
hopefully you can retire once this transaction is
completed and you won't have to worry about further
embarrassments.

A little about myself. I am 27 years old and I am a
principal downhill race driver for my own team, Go
Munglers! I have been racing for 10 years now and have
so far - knock wood - not been defeated. I did have a
most unfortunate accident last year when a flying
badger crashed into my windshield during a race and I
was hospitalized for a while. The results of that race
were wiped from the records when my opponent and his
team vanished in gruesome circumstances.

Can't say I've had too much dealings in hockey. Is it
some kind of card game? You can teach me how to play
it when you come to Japan! We could put some money
down.

I am still waiting for the bank to write back.

Reply immediately,
Phil

PS  I was of the impression that I was dealing with a
Mr Nteje and yet you have signed your name as "Mr
Muktar Mohamed". I assume that an explanation is
forthcoming.

messages.body:
Feb 17

Allwell/ Muktar

The bank have finally responded, I am pleased to say.
Their board of directors are currently discussing my
application. I am not too optimistic of them reaching
a decision by summer though - in my experience all
directors do is sit around all day eating noodles and
watching pornography. I only hope these guys are more
professional.

So you want to invest in real estate, eh? Pretty good
market but also damn expensive. What sort of
properties are you interested in? Let me know and I'll
look into it for you. Bear in mind that you will need
to do some work before your immigration papers can be
considered, but we'll deal with that later.

I personally will be investing all the money into my
racing team. I'm tired of paying Top Secret their
exorbitant prices to tune my cars, and the less said
about my mechanics the better. A change of staff and
fleet will be splendid. I will also be hiring a hit
squad to eradicate any and all flying badgers in
Japan.

Indeed, after being undefeated for 10 years I am
something of a champion. Each race wins 6.5million yen
and there are 20 races per year. That's a lot of loot!
I would like to say that the success is down as much
to my staff as it is my driving, but that would be a
complete lie.

You ask about my parents. My mother runs a tofu shop
and my father is involved in matters which I would
rather not discuss at this time.

I'm still not familiar with this "huckey" thing.
Sounds a bit silly to me, the sort of game Barazoku
readers would play.

Reply immediately.
Phil

Allwell

Relax my little kuso atama. 

I've been busy this weekend. Busy winning races and
entertaining myself with some comely wenches.

The bank have sent me a ridiculous list of documents
that they need to be sent for some ungodly reason.
I've pasted in their email so you can get to work on
knocking up the required bumph.

handling such important business when she should be
making tea? Things certainly seem to work different in
Lome.

Now I have TOGO and buy a new flux capacitor for my
mother or she'll never get her tofu out in time.

Reply immediately when you've read the crazy email
from the bank (see below).

Phil

I'm still trying to absorb all the information here.

So this "Jmaes Henry" is right? Looks like that
yurizoku at Peace and Peace has hideously misspelled
the name "James" to me. I think  we'd better get the
facts right before we pay money to someone who doesn't
exist, don't you?

at least part of this bill from Peace and Peace. You
didn't warn me about that did you? I am disappointed.
As for your suggestion that I am stingy, I will forget
that for now.

The offer to kill the bastards who robbed you is
always open. Remember when I said that my father was
involved in matters I didn't want to discuss? Well, he
is part of my prefectures largest Yakuza cell. Do you
know what Yakuza is? They are not to be messed with. I
could have a couple of gentlemen anywhere in the world
to take someone out. With swords. Bear it in mind,
yes?

kind of vehicle you drive. As a racer I am always keen
to know what people move themselves around in. I think
that you can tell a lot about a man by what he drives.

Reply immediately
Phil

messages.body:
Allwell

Do you see the kind of people we're dealing with here?
They can't even spell a man's name right! I insist
that we hire another lawyer. Look into it at once for
me.

Yakuza are a circle of legitimate businessmen here in
Japan. I believe the Italian equivalent is the
"mafia". My father has often made the gesture to me
that if I want someone dismembered he will arrange it
for me, wherever in the world that person may be. At
first I was shocked by this offer but since then I
have take him up on it thirteen times. The first one
is the hardest, after that it just gets funnier.

Make arrangements with new lawyers and then we'll know
exactly how much I need to send to you. Please hurry
along!

I'm not sure what a Honda Acura is, but I am glad you
have a Japanese car. Send me a picture of it so that I
know what you're talking about.

Meanwhile, I will try to placate the bank as they are
hassling me again. This is what happens when you let
women run the show, and why you should never let them
anywhere near your car.

Reply immediately
Phil

I phoned the bank to arrange transfer of funds to Peace and Peace, but the manager needed the signature of myself and Takumi to release the funds as Takumi is a partner. Takumi met me there. On the way back one of those FULKING flying bastards smashed into my car AGAIN - if I had taken my Skyline it is fitted with Anti-badger radar and the accident could have been avoided. I crashed into a load of junk and was knocked out and had to spend the night in hospital.

In the meantime, Takumi accessed my email to see if any business emails had come it. He thought he would help by telling you what happened and you decided to flame him, god knows why. I do not find any of these events particularly amusing so I take umbrage at your suggestions of tomfoolery.

I have sent the lawyers the information regarding the money transfer. Hopefully things can get back on track now.

If Takumi has cause to write to youy again I suggest you adopt a more civil attitude with him.

Matane,
Phil

Of course, Phil hasn't actually sent a thing to Peace and Peace. However, Allwell is not known to either them or the bank so theoretically there's no way he can check on this.
